worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #4664: WIP ARROW-5697: [GLib] Fix docker-compose build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4664
 
 
   Without the current changes, the build fails with
   
   ```
   Dependency arrow found: YES 0.14.0-SNAPSHOT
   Dependency arrow-orc found: YES 0.14.0-SNAPSHOT
   Found CMake: /opt/conda/bin/cmake (3.14.5)
   Dependency arrow-cuda found: NO (tried pkgconfig and cmake)
   Dependency gandiva found: YES 0.14.0-SNAPSHOT
   Dependency parquet found: YES 1.5.1-SNAPSHOT
   Dependency plasma found: YES 0.14.0-SNAPSHOT
   Configuring version.h using configuration
   Dependency gobject-2.0 found: NO (tried pkgconfig and cmake)
   
   arrow-glib/meson.build:194:0: ERROR: Dependency "gobject-2.0" not found, tried pkgconfig and cmake
   ```
   
   It is now failing with
   
   ```
   [14/65] Compiling C++ object 'arrow-glib/20f505c@@arrow-glib@sha/field.cpp.o'.
   FAILED: arrow-glib/20f505c@@arrow-glib@sha/field.cpp.o 
   g++ -Iarrow-glib/20f505c@@arrow-glib@sha -Iarrow-glib -I../../arrow/c_glib/arrow-glib -I. -I../../arrow/c_glib/ -I/opt/conda/include -I/usr/lib/include/glib-2.0 -I/usr/lib/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/glib-2.0/include -I/usr/lib/include -fdiagnostics-color=always -pipe -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -Wall -Winvalid-pch -Wnon-virtual-dtor -std=c++11 -g -DARROW_NO_DEPRECATED_API -fPIC -pthread -MD -MQ 'arrow-glib/20f505c@@arrow-glib@sha/field.cpp.o' -MF 'arrow-glib/20f505c@@arrow-glib@sha/field.cpp.o.d' -o 'arrow-glib/20f505c@@arrow-glib@sha/field.cpp.o' -c ../../arrow/c_glib/arrow-glib/field.cpp
   In file included from ../../arrow/c_glib/arrow-glib/decimal128.h:22:0,
                    from ../../arrow/c_glib/arrow-glib/basic-data-type.h:22,
                    from ../../arrow/c_glib/arrow-glib/basic-data-type.hpp:24,
                    from ../../arrow/c_glib/arrow-glib/data-type.hpp:22,
                    from ../../arrow/c_glib/arrow-glib/field.cpp:24:
   ../../arrow/c_glib/arrow-glib/gobject-type.h:22:10: fatal error: glib-object.h: No such file or directory
    #include <glib-object.h>
             ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   compilation terminated.
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

fsaintjacques commented on issue #4664: WIP ARROW-5697: [GLib] Fix docker-compose build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4664#issuecomment-505420613
 
 
   @kou note that I added the path in PKG_CONFIG_PATH because conda's pkg-config is getting picked up.
   
   Is glib installed twice? `-I/usr/lib/include/glib-2.0 -I/usr/lib/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/glib-2.0/include`
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #4664: WIP ARROW-5697: [GLib] Fix docker-compose build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4664#issuecomment-505635074
 
 
   I couldn't try this yet but GLib installs its headers to two locations. `/usr/include/glib-2.0` is for platform independent headers. `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/glib-2.0/include` is for platform dependent headers. For example, they depend on `long` size on the system.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

kou commented on issue #4664: ARROW-5697: [GLib] Fix docker-compose build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4664#issuecomment-506038326
 
 
   I've fixed this.
   This problem is caused by `pkg-config` provided by Conda. (`PATH=/opt/conda/bin:$PATH` in `cpp/Dockerfile`)
   We should use system `pkg-config` to use system libraries such as GLib.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
